intro: Schismatoglottis acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved schismatoglottis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves that are sharply pointed, giving it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Schismatoglottis acutifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
